content.description:
This is what you get for a warm up at The Pumphouse.   

     The crux is from bolts 2-4 before the climb gives way to featured and more pleasant climbing above, but there are still some tricks as you will navigate sloping ledges and longish moves to a final mantle right before the chains.  

     This climb is well worth getting on.
content.location: On the upper tier of the Pumphouse this climb is two climbs before the last going left --> right.

climbs.name: Neon Highway
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Tiffany Bertelsen, Jon Mavko, Kemper Brightman - 2017

content.description:
All good things are worth waiting for.  This route was no exception.   

    After some on and off cleaning efforts over a year I finally finished bolting this climb in the spring of 2017.  Initially I thought it would pair nicely with the other low to mid 12s of the area and be of similar difficulty, but during the first runs up the route it became apparent it was much harder.   

     Neon Highway gets real right off the ground with a stout and amazing boulder problem from bolts one to three.  Long moves on sloping rails plus a mini jump deposit you at the base of a giant flake.  Rest up here because difficulties resume as soon as you leave the flake.  Grab amazing sculpted and slippery crimps and faint arete holds as the wall steepens.  If you can make some more long and accurate moves, get fancy with your heels, and manage the long pulls to holds over the lip of the wall.......... you will clip the chains of a fine new addition to the Pumphouse. 

     This route is amazing and should not be missed.
content.location: In between Backroad Ballet and Forged in Hell.

content.description:
Follow the first three bolts of Forged in Hell then break right following a right facing corner and flakes. 

     This route is named for two very fun and alternating heel and rock over moves in the middle of the route.  You also get some fun compression climbing and NO crimps!  That's right, you heard it hear, if you're crimping you ain't doing it right. 

     Solve your way through the middle crux and the difficulties ease off ending with a fun undercling and mantle series of moves just prior to the chains.
content.location: Shared start with Forged in Hell.  Easy to identify anchors located in a prominent dihedral at the top of the formation.

content.description: Overhanging almost 20 feet this is not your standard Mount Lemmon crimp fest. Stout move about fifteen feet up is avoided if you are taller but then it is on. Once you pull on to the arete you make a hard move to a rail and traverse right for 7 feet joining Neon Highway or at least using some of it's footholds as you follow a left angling weakness to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts, one cable draw to make it easier to clean the lower half. Anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route at the Pumphouse. Starts in a steep broken looking corner thing.

content.description: Shallow right facing dihedral to big rest flake then face.  No really hard moves but it is pumpy at the end.
content.protection:
Bolts, Anchors

 Bolts and top-anchors updated by CASA in 2017.
content.location: On the lower left end of the crag.

content.description: This cliff is shady almost all day as it faces NW and is very overhanging.  The approach used to be a bit harder but due to the fire and recent development at the Chessman it is pretty casual now. It is a good idea to warm up at the Chessmen.
